column4: thmcmahon: hello..following output by executing command: sudo rm -r /home/user/.*  : couldnt remove..
thmcmahon: /help nick
hello
what are you trying to do?
why are you trying to remove the hidden directories under your home folder?
im am tring to recover my messed gdm
why didn't you back them up before removing?
becouse i was stupid and didnt think on my own
we all learn from our own mistakes :)
at least now you won't likely repeat that mistake
never..but i feel realy lamed now..i am not a geek...normal user without much hackintg experience
ist there any possibility to recover this data?
in other words, it might be possible but not likely (or easy)
i must try it
better i dont reboot now
i alway keep my important stuff on another partition and back it up on an external harddrive
my /home/is on external partition
i don't keep my important data on /home/
it is good practice to keep important data seperate from the OS
how i said...i had never problems like this
now you see why it is good practice (not nice to learn the hard way though)
i look on the documantation but i dont see there any possibility to recover explicite folders...just all partitions. I m affraid to do that
i came here for help
i thought it is a support channel
i can only help you with what i know
s√≥metimes is very hard to hear that the really big supporter making advice to the people as they should lknow everything..
i've never had to restore my data, but i have given you advise on why it is important to have backups
thank you
sorry i can't help you recover the data, my experience in that area is very limited
okay, thank you anyway very much
when you say start gdm are you referring to the login manager?
yes i do
the login manager should start on its own
what version of ubuntu are you using?
it is starting but looks differrent and also gdm power manager complains
there is no such thing as gdm power manager
gdm is the gnome display manager
some power manager or something
so gdm (the login screen) loads fine and you can enter your username and password?
yes...but it looks crappy ..i can choose there users but no other options available as normal
what happens when you login?
it gives error...something with sanity-check of gconf
sorry i cant say now exactly#
and that is with the newly created user?
yes also with the new created user
hmm, something is very broken
when did you first have this problem
yes. my disk?
it apears yesterday during some installation of eclipse plugins...i lost suddenly permissions. i have reboot and saw sanity-check errors
i discover also another problems with mktemp
where did you get the eclipse plugins from? did you install eclipse from the repo?
no, i have removed ecliupse from the repos and took brand fresh indigo version from the eclipse site
ah, that means we can't support you with eclipse
becouse i have problems with installing subcliupse plugin, some developer told me this is becouse the old ubuntu repe bvuild
how old is your harddrive?
eclipse is not the problem right now...i can leave without eclipse
let me think..some 3 years...it is sata
hmm, my guess is that eclipse is to blame
what are you suggesting? to go and by new hd and install fresh system?
shit..thats bad
i'm not sure how you installed it, but i'd reccomend removing it
how can be possible that eclipse messed so badly system?=
i don't know, but if this problen occurred directly after installing the plugins, something changed somewhere that broke something
sorry for my language! thats becouse im so destroyed now :)
things like this is why i only stick to what is in the official repos
i will go now to by a new disk, and i will try to install new system. could you tell me if this brand new ubuntu is good and stable enough for my all hard core grafix stuff?
11.10 works fine for me
not sure why you want to get a new harddrive
i will need to install blender cycles render machine, with newwest nvidia driver, opensim server with mono, eclipse indigo and lot of other tools
do you use a lot of ppas?
yes...
i see :)
ppas are unsupported
but no worry...i was always looking for conflicts
but my work is so that i need tools which are not in repos
the more ppas you use the more likely something might break
i know that problem. but i must go on, that is my bread..:)
no wonder you have loads of problems, i never use ppas and i've never had any problems
look, becouse i cant solvve my problem now, and anyway my disk ist almost full, i rthink it is a goof ideea to buy new one and install new system
i don't often say this but i think perhaps you would want to try a different distribution which supports the software you need
or maybe you have anothere ideea ? i am very open
i do not know windows system  and im only using open source
i didn't suggest windows
maybe thoise archlinux would better support my intrest?
i use arch and its very good, but this is getting a little offtopic for ubuntu support
i understand..puh...
feel free to pmme if you want to talk about other distros
i will come back... i go to to buy a new disk. suddenly i am very decided to do that as a right
thank you very very much for your friendly help
no worries :)
hi
